title: Duplicate Stats
description: Per-group duplicate read statistics from the DOWNSTREAM workflow. Each row represents a duplicate group: a set of reads with matching alignment positions (within configurable tolerance) to the same genome.

fields.name: prim_align_genome_id_all
fields.title: Genome ID
fields.description: NCBI accession ID(s) of the genome(s) that reads in this duplicate group aligned to. For split alignments where forward and reverse reads map to different genomes, IDs are joined with '/' and sorted alphabetically.

fields.name: prim_align_dup_exemplar
fields.title: Exemplar Read ID
fields.description: Query name (read ID) of the exemplar read selected to represent this duplicate group. The exemplar is the read with the highest average quality score; ties are broken by query name.

fields.name: prim_align_dup_count
fields.title: Duplicate Count
fields.description: Number of reads in this duplicate group. A value of 1 indicates a unique read with no duplicates.

fields.name: prim_align_dup_pairwise_match_frac
fields.title: Pairwise Match Fraction
fields.description: Quality control metric indicating the fraction of all pairwise comparisons within the duplicate group that match according to the position tolerance. A value of 1.0 indicates perfect transitivity (all pairs match); lower values may indicate fuzzy grouping edge cases.
